intro: Indomelothria chlorocarpa subsp. chlorocarpa, commonly known as the green-fruit indomelothria, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its fruits are small, dry, and three-lobed, with a greenish hue that gives it its common name. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils.
